div.p: Hi. I'm Hollie Knauss.
I'm the Bursar here at DeSales University.
I want to give you some information concerning when we do our billing for ACCESS students
and some options for payments and things like that that we have.
We do our billing a session at a time.
So for example, if you'd be starting with the fall session, you'd actually be billed
for that session about three weeks before the session would start.
It would be due before the class actually begins if you're going to be making payments.
We do have several options.
You can pay online through your Web Advisory account by using the Make a Payment link.
You can also pay by using some financial aid which would be a financial aid deferment
if you've completed all your forms with the Financial Aid office.
You can use that to cover the balance on your account,
or a portion of the balance for your classes.
You do need to take six credits to be eligible for financial aid.
So that would be a combination of either session one six credits, or sessions one
and two six credits combined between those.
Or you can also include the mid semester (or mini semester) that is offered as well.
We do a tuition deferment or company deferment as well.
We would need a copy of your policy from your company,
or a letter indicating what their policy is for reimbursement.
At that point you would not need to make payment for the course once we have that information.
WE would end up then billing you for that course 8 weeks after the session ends for that course.
So you would be sending that grade and your paperwork into your employer
and payment would be due after the session ends.
As an example, if you take a Session 1 class and you use company deferment, you would need to pay
for that class by the beginning of Session 3.
So we do skip an eight-week session in there so that you can have time
to submit your grade and your paperwork.
We also do have payment plans that you're able to do.
The payment plan that we do is a Three Payment payment plan for a session.
You would make the first payment before the class starts.
The second payment is due halfway through the class-four weeks into the class.
The last payment is due before the course ends and that session ends.
For the day students, we do actually take payments over the entire semester.
So if you are taking a day class as well, you can take that and split it
up over the five months that you're attending classes.
Our Bursar's Office is located on the second floor of Dooling Hall.
There are two places you can go-either the Bursar's Office window or the Bursar's Office.
Our main contact is Joann Seif and you can reach her in the Bursar's Office at the window.
Our hours are Monday - Thursday during the regular school year from 8:00 to 5:30.
On Fridays, we are open from 8:00 to 5:00.
During the summer, we are open from 8:00 to 5:00 Monday through Friday.
You can give us phone call.
We can always take questions that way.
You can make payment with a credit card over the phone, or through WebAdvisor like I mentioned.
If you have any questions, feel free to give us a call.
Thank you.
